question: Three of a kind. Let's do this. One of the Clowns looks up from loading his automatic weapon. There's two on the roof. Every guy is an extra share. Five shares is plenty. Yeah? He thinks he can sit it out and still take a slice then I get why they call him the Joker. Grumpy cocks his weapon. Bozo pulls the car over in front of the GOTHAM FIRST NATIONAL BANK.
answer: Why do they call him the Joker? Make-up? Dopey pulls out thick bundles of blue CAT 5 cables. Is it a problem?

question: Obviously, we don't want you doing anything with your hands other than holding on for dear life. BLAM. Chuckles is BLOWN OFF HIS FEET- Grumpy and Bozo DIVE for cover- the Bank Manager steps out of his office, SHOTGUN in hand. Hostages SCRAMBLE, CLINGING their grenades... He's got three left? Bozo raises TWO fingers. Grumpy squeezes off a SHOT. The Bank Manager FIRES. FIRES again. Grumpy looks at Bozo, who nods. Grumpy JUMPS UP. The Bank Manager FIRES- Grumpy GRUNTS as buckshot CLIPS his shoulder. FALLS. The Bank Manager moves in for the kill, FUMBLING for new shells. Bozo STANDS- SHOOTS him. Bozo picks up the shotgun. Grumpy checks his wound- it's superficial. He struggles to his feet. Where'd you learn to count?! Bozo's mask stares him down. Grumpy heads for the stairs in the back. Bozo starts loading fresh shells into the shotgun.
answer: They wired this thing up with 5,000 volts. What kind of bank does that?

question: A mob bank. Guess the Joker's as crazy as they say. Happy shrugs. Grips the WHEEL BOLT and SPINS it. Where's the alarm guy?
answer: Boss told me when the guy was done I should take him out. One less share.

question: Ever intending to see your wife again, Lieutenant?
answer: I thought you had to go look after your mother, detective.

question: They checked her back into hospital.
answer: I'm sorry.

question: Least there she's got someone round the clock. Unlike your wife. He hasn't shown? Gordon gets up. Looks into the sky at the bat-signal.
answer: Often doesn't. But I like reminding everybody that he's out there.

question: Why wouldn't he come?
answer: Hopefully... Because he's busy.

question: Him again. Who are the others?
answer: Another bunch of small timers. Batman pulls a DEVICE from his belt- moves to the bundles of cash scattered near the clown's body. The device PINGS. Batman picks up a BUNDLE. Hands it to Gordon.

question: Some of the marked bills I gave you.
answer: My detectives have been making drug buys with them for weeks. This bank was another drop for the mob. That makes five banks- we've found the bulk of their dirty cash.

question: Time to move in. Gordon waves the photo.
answer: What about this Joker guy?

question: One man or the entire mob? He can wait.
answer: We'll have to hit all banks simultaneously. SWAT teams, backup. Gordon holds up the bundle of banknotes. When the new DA gets wind of this, he'll want in.

question: Do you trust him?
answer: Be hard to keep him out. Gordon bags the cash. I hear he's as stubborn as you. But Batman is already gone.

question: Be nice when Wayne Manor's rebuilt and you can swap not sleeping in a penthouse for not sleeping in a mansion. Alfred places a cup of coffee in front of Wayne, who is STITCHING up a cut on his arm. When you stitch yourself up you make a bloody mess.
answer: But I learn from my mistakes.

question: You ought to be pretty knowledgeable by now, then.
answer: My armor... I'm carrying too much weight- I need to be faster.

question: I'm sure Mr.Fox can oblige. Did you get mauled by a tiger?
answer: A dog. A big dog. There were more copycats last night, Alfred. With guns.

question: Perhaps you could hire some of them and take weekends off.
answer: This wasn't exactly what I had in mind when I said I wanted to inspire people.

question: I know. But things are improving. Look at the new District Attorney... Wayne indicates a monitor
answer: I am. Closely. I need to know if he can be trusted. Alfred looks at other images- the D.A. at a meeting. Campaigning. Helping someone out of a cab

question: Are you interested in his character... or his social circle?
answer: Who Rachel spends her time with is her business.

question: Well, I trust you're not following me on my day off.
answer: If you ever took one, I might.

question: Know your limits, Master Wayne.
answer: Batman has no limits.

question: Well, you do, sir.
answer: I can't afford to know them.

question: And what happens the day you find out?
answer: We all know how much you like to say 'I told you so'.

question: Sorry I'm late, folks. Rachel leans in to Dent, speaking under her breath.
answer: Where were you?

question: Worried you'd have to step up?
answer: I know the briefs backwards. Dent pulls a large silver dollar out of his pocket. Grins.

question: Well, then, fair's fair
answer: You're flipping coins to see who leads?

question: My father's lucky coin. As I recall, it got me my first date with you.
answer: I'm serious, Harvey, you don't leave things like this to chance.

question: Tee-off's 1:30. More than enough time to put you away for life, Sally. The BAILIFFS lead a THIN MAN into the witness box. ROSSI. With Carmine Falcone in Arkham, someone must've stepped up to run the so-called family. Is this man in the courtroom today? Could you identify him for us, please? Dent turns to Maroni, who is poker-faced. Dent smiles. I've got a sworn statement from you that this man, Salvatore Maroni, is the new head of the Falcone crime family. Permission to treat the witness as hostile? Ceramic 28 caliber. Made in China. If you want to kill a public servant, Mr. Maroni, I recommend you buy American. Everyone STARES, open-mouthed, as Dent adjusts his tie. The Bailiffs are wrestling Rossi from the box- But, your honor, I'm not done...
answer: We'll never link the gun to Maroni, so we can't charge him, but I'll tell you one thing- the fact they tried to kill you means we're getting to them.

question: Glad you're so pleased, Rachel. I'm fine by the way. Rachel turns to Dent. Smooths his lapels.
answer: Harvey, you're Gotham's D.A.- if you're not getting shot at, you're not doing your job. 'Course if you said you were rattled we could take the rest of the day...

question: Can't. I dragged the head of the Major Crimes Unit down here.
answer: Jim Gordon? He's a friend- try to be nice.

question: Word is you've got a hell of a right cross. Shame Sal's going to walk.
answer: Well, good thing about the mob is they keep giving you second chances. Dent picks up a bundle of bills from the heist. Lightly irradiated bills. Fancy stuff for a city cop. Have help?

question: We liaise with various agencies-
answer: Save it, Gordon. I want to meet him.

question: Official policy is to arrest the vigilante known as Batman on sight.
answer: And that flood light on top of

question: If you have any concerns about... malfunctioning equipment... take them up with maintenance, counselor. Dent tosses the bills back onto his desk. Annoyed.
answer: I've put every known money launderer in Gotham behind bars. But the mob is still getting its money out. I think you and your "friend" have found the last game in town and you're trying to hit 'em where it hurts

question: In this town, the fewer people know something, the safer the operation.
answer: Gordon, I don't like that you've got your own special unit, and I don't like that it's full of cops I investigated at internal affairs.

question: If I didn't work with cops you'd investigated while you were making your name at I.A.- I'd be working alone. I don't get political points for being an idealist- I have to do the best I can with what I have. Dent looks at Gordon. Considering how to proceed.
answer: You want me to back warrants for search and seizure on five banks without telling me who we're after?

question: I can give you the names of the banks.
answer: Well, that's a start. I'll get you your warrants. But I want your trust.

question: You don't have to sell me, Dent. We all know you're Gotham's white knight.
answer: I hear they've got a different nickname for me down at M.C.U.. Gordon smiles.

question: We'll be in touch as soon as our people have wrapped up the diligence. The elevator doors close. Reese frowns.
answer: Sir, I know Mr.Wayne's curious how his trust fund gets replenished but frankly... it's embarrassing. Fox heads for his office, Reese in tow.

question: You worry about the diligence, Mr. Reese. I'll worry about Bruce Wayne.
answer: It's done- the numbers are solid.

question: Do it again. Wouldn't want the trust fund to run out, would we? Another long night? This joint venture was your idea, and the consultants love it, but I'm not convinced. L.S.I.'s grown 8 percent annually, like clockwork. They must have a revenue stream that's off the books. Maybe even illegal.
answer: OK. Cancel the deal.

question: You already knew.
answer: I needed a closer look at their books.

question: Anything else you can trouble me for?
answer: I need a new suit.

question: Three buttons is a little nineties.
answer: I'm not talking about fashion, Mr.Fox, so much as function. Wayne pulls some diagrams. Fox looks them over.

question: You want to be able to turn your head?
answer: Sure make backing out of the driveway easier.

question: They should! I own the place.
answer: For how long? About three weeks?

question: How'd you know?
answer: Natascha, aren't you...?

question: Prima ballerina for the Moscow Ballet.
answer: Harvey's taking me next week.

question: You're into ballet, Harvey?
answer: No. He knows I am. An extra table arrives.

question: Well, I guess you either die a hero or you live long enough to see yourself become the villain. Look, whoever the Batman is, he doesn't want to spend the rest of his life doing this. How could he?
answer: Someone like you, Mr.Dent?

question: Maybe. If I'm up to it. Natascha reaches up and covers the top half of Dent's face.
answer: But what if Harvey Dent is the caped crusader?

question: Half. Laughter. The Joker shrugs. Rises. You don't deal with this now, soon Gambol won't even be able to get a nickel for his grandma-
answer: Enough from the clown. Gambol gets up, MOVING at the Joker, who casually opens his coat, revealing EXPLOSIVES wired to his chest. Gambol stops.

question: Let's not blow this out of all proportion. Gambol stares at the Joker. Hard.
answer: You think you can steal from us and just walk away? I'm putting the word out- 5 hundred grand for this clown dead. A million alive, so I get to teach him some manners, first. The Joker shrugs. Turns to the assembled.

question: You're a hard man to reach. Gordon BURSTS onto the rooftop, weapon drawn. Sees Dent. Lau's halfway to Hong Kong- if you'd asked, I could have taken his passport- I told you to keep me in the loop.
answer: Yeah? All that was left in the vaults were the marked bills- they knew we were coming! As soon as your office got involved, there's a leak-

question: My office?! You're sitting down here with scum like Wuertz and Ramirez... Oh, yeah, Gordon- I almost had your rookie cold on a racketeering beef.
answer: Don't try to cloud the fact that clearly Maroni's got people in your office, Dent. Dent turns to Batman.

question: Our Chinese friend left town before I could tell him the deal is off.
answer: I'm sure you've always wanted to go to Hong Kong. Fox opens the door to a private elevator.

question: What's wrong with a phone call?
answer: I think Mr.Lau deserves a more personal touch.

question: For high altitude jumps, you need oxygen and stabilizers. I must say- compared to your usual requests, jumping out of an airplane is pretty straightforward.
answer: How about getting back into the plane?

question: I can recommend a good travel agent.
answer: Without it landing.

question: That's more like it, Mr.Wayne. He shuts the drawer. Moves off, thinking. I don't think I have anything here. The CIA had a program in the '60s for getting their people out of hot spots. Called Sky Hook. Now- Fox opens a cabinet to reveal COMPONENTS OF A NEW BAT-SUIT. ARMORED PLATING secured to mesh. Wayne lifts an arm. Hardened kevlar plates on a titanium- dipped fiber tri-weave for flexibility... Wayne examines DOUBLE BLADE SCALLOPS on the gauntlet... You'll be lighter, faster, more agile... Wayne flinches as the BLADES FIRE, SPINNING LIKE THROWING STARS, NARROWLY MISSING his ear, embedding themselves in a filing cabinet. Fox looks at him. Perhaps you should read the instructions, first.
answer: Sorry. Fox picks up the chest, demonstrating its flexibility.

question: Now, there's a trade-off... the spread of the plates gives you weak spots. You'll be more vulnerable to gunfire and knives.
answer: We wouldn't want things getting too easy, would we? How will it hold up against dogs? Fox looks at him quizzically.

question: I found one. In Arizona. Very nice man says it will take him a week to get it running. And he takes cash. What about a flight crew?
answer: South Korean smugglers. They run flights into Pyongyang, below radar the whole way. Did you think of an alibi? Alfred looks quite pleased with himself.

question: Oh, yes. I believe your plane is here.
answer: You look tired, Alfred. Will you be all right without me? A Ballerina rolls over- waves the suntan lotion at Alfred.

question: I understand!
answer: I must apologize for leaving Gotham in the middle of our negotiations. This misunderstanding with the Gotham police force... I couldn't let such a thing threaten my company. A businessman of your stature will understand. But with you here... we can continue.

question: Well, it was good of you to bring me out here in such style, Mr.Lau. But I've actually come... A CELL PHONE rings. Fox pulls out a second, identical, phone. Fox presses the off switch and places the phone by his plate.
answer: We do not allow cell phones in-

question: Sorry. Forgot I had it. So, I've come to explain why we're going to have to put our deal on hold... Lau stares at Fox. Clearly furious. Fox smiles. We can't afford to be seen to do business with... well, whatever it is you're accused of being. A businessman of your stature will understand. Lau gets up. Silent. Fox retrieves his phone. Stands.
answer: I think, Mr.Fox, that a simple phone call might have sufficed.

question: Well, I do love Chinese food. And Mr.Wayne didn't want you to think we'd been deliberately wasting your time.
answer: Just accidentally wasting it.

question: That's very good- "accidentally". Very good. I'll be sure and tell Mr.Wayne that he was wrong about you not having a sense of humor. There's a better view from the peak tram. Wayne turns to find Fox standing there, street map out.
answer: How's the view from L.S.I.Holdings?

question: Restricted. Lau's holed up in there good and tight. Here... Fox shows Wayne the phone. The display
answer: What's this?

question: I had R and D work it up- it sends out high frequencies and records the response time to map an environment.
answer: Sonar. Just like a b-

question: Submarine. Like a submarine.
answer: And the other device?

question: Give us the money and we'll deal.
answer: The money is the only reason I'm still alive. Rachel leans forward, speaking softly. Clearly.

question: You mean when they hear that you've helped us they're going to kill you? No, I'm just assuming your client's cooperation with this investigation. As will everyone. Enjoy your stay in County, Mr.Lau.
answer: Wait. I won't give you the money, but I'll give you my clients. All of them.

question: You were a glorified accountant- what could you have on all of them that we could charge?
answer: I'm good with calculation- I handled all their investments. One big pot.

question: He can't go to County. I'll keep him here in the holding cells.
answer: What is this Gordon, your fortress?

question: You trust them over at County?
answer: I don't trust them here.

question: Lau stays.
answer: It's your call, Lieutenant. Be right.

question: I am, counselor.
answer: I don't know about Mr. Lau's travel arrangements... ...but I'm sure glad he's back. Maroni and the Chechen are watching the TV.

question: 549 criminals at once?! How did you convince Surrillo to hear this farce?
answer: She shares my enthusiasm for justice. After all, she is a judge.

question: Even if you blow enough smoke to get convictions out of Surrillo, you'll set a new record at appeals for quickest kick in the ass.
answer: It won't matter. The head guys make bail, sure... but the mid-level guys, they can't, and they can't afford to be off the streets long enough for trial and appeal. They'll cut deals that include some jail time. Think of all you could do with 18 months of clean streets. The Mayor waves Gordon and Loeb out.

question: How's it going?
answer: I think your fundraiser will be a great success, sir.

question: And why do you think I wanted to hold a party for Harvey Dent?
answer: I assumed it was your usual reason for socialising beyond myself and the scum of Gotham's underbelly

question: Rachel-
answer: A little liquid courage, Mr.Dent? Dent turns to see Alfred with drinks on a silver tray.

question: Thanks. Alfred, right?
answer: Yes, sir.

question: Rachel talks about you all the time. You've known her her whole life?
answer: Not yet, sir.

question: Any psychotic ex-boyfriends I should be aware of?
answer: Oh, you have no idea. Alfred leaves Dent standing there, puzzled. The crowd REACTS as a LOUD ROAR drowns conversation... Dent looks out-

question: That Joker card pinned to the body? Forensics found three sets of D.N.A..
answer: Any matches?

question: All three. Gordon STOPS. Turns to face her. The D.N.A. belongs to Judge Surrillo, Harvey Dent and Commissioner Loeb.
answer: The Joker's telling us who he's targeting- get a unit to Surrillo's house, tell Wuertz to find Dent- get them both into protective custody. Where's the Commissioner?

question: City hall.
answer: Seal the building. No one in or out till I get there.

question: You cannot leave me on my own with these people.
answer: The whole mob's after you and you're worried about these guys?

question: Compared to this, the mob doesn't scare me. Although, I will say
answer: Oh, yeah?

question: Yeah. It makes you think about what you couldn't stand losing. And who you want to spend the rest of your life with... Rachel looks at Dent. Smiles.
answer: The rest of your life, huh? That's a pretty big commitment.

question: Not if the mob has their way.
answer: Don't.

question: Okay. Let's be serious. What's your answer? Rachel looks at him.
answer: I don't have an answer.

question: Hello, beautiful. You must be Harvey's squeeze. And you are beautiful. You look nervous- it's the scars isn't it? Wanna know how I got them? I had a wife, beautiful like you. Who tells me I worry too much. Who says I need to smile more. Who gambles. And gets in deep with the sharks. One day they carve her face, and we've got no money for surgeries. She can't take it. I just want to see her smile again. I just want her to know I don't care about the scars. So I put a razor in my mouth and do this to myself... And you know what? She can't stand the sight of me... She leaves! See, now I see the funny side. Now I'm always smiling. A little fight in you. I like that.
answer: Then you're going to love me. The Joker turns. Batman catches him with a BLOW, spins him down and DISARMS him- the Joker's men jump him- Batman takes them out two at a time- DISARMING thugs- BREAKING forearms- the Joker CLICKS a BLADE from the toe of his shoe and KICKS- JABBING BETWEEN THE PLATES OF ARMOR covering Batman's ribcage- Batman HURLS the Joker across the room. One of the Joker's men LUNGES- Batman lays him out cold. The Joker has another knife pressed to Rachel's neck. Drop the knife.

question: Sure. Just take off your mask and show us all who you are... Rachel shakes her head at Batman. The Joker raises his shotgun to the side and BLOWS OUT the pane of glass next to him. The Joker dangles Rachel out the window.
answer: Let her go.

question: Very poor choice of words... He lets her DROP- Rachel falls onto a SLOPING GLASS ROOF- sliding towards the edge Batman DIVES after her- I'm a man of my word.
answer: Are you alright?

question: Jim, it's over.
answer: As long as they don't get to Lau, we've cut off their funds.

question: But the prosecution's over. No-one's standing up in front of a Judge while judges and police commissioners are getting blown away.
answer: What about Dent?

question: Targeting me won't get their money back. I knew the mob wouldn't go down without a fight, but this is different. They've crossed a line.
answer: You crossed it first, sir. You've hammered them, squeezed them to the point of desperation. And now, in their desperation they've turned to a man they don't fully understand. Wayne gets up from his monitors, raises the bat-cabinet.

question: Criminals aren't complicated, Alfred. We just have to figure out what he's after.
answer: Respectfully, Master Wayne, perhaps this is a man you don't fully understand, either. I was in Burma. A long time ago. My friends and I were working for the local government. They were trying to buy the loyalty of tribal leaders, bribing them with precious stones. But their caravans were being raided in a forest north of Rangoon by a bandit. We were asked to take care of the problem, so we started looking for the stones. But after six months, we couldn't find anyone who had traded with him.

question: What were you missing?
answer: One day I found a child playing with a ruby as big as a tangerine. The bandit had been throwing the stones away.

question: So why was he stealing them?
answer: Because he thought it was good sport. Because some men aren't looking for anything logical, like money... they can't be bought, bullied, reasoned or negotiated with. Some men just want to watch the world burn. Wayne stares at Alfred. Reaches for the bat-suit.

question: What can I do for you, Mr. Reese?
answer: You asked me to do the diligence on the L.S.I.Holdings deal again. I found irregularities.

question: Their CEO is in police custody.
answer: Not with their numbers. With yours. A whole division of Wayne Industries disappeared, overnight. So I went down to the archives and started pulling old files. He pulls out a folded blueprint. Slides it across the desk. My kids love the Batman. I thought he was pretty cool, too. Out there, kicking some ass. Fox picks up the piece of paper. Unfolds it. It's an old BLUEPRINT. The image is unmistakable Changes things when you know it's just a rich kid playing dress up. Reese points to the approval box in the corner of the page. Your project. Don't tell me you didn't recognize your baby pancaking cop cars on the evening news. Now you're getting sloppy. Applied Sciences was a small, dead department- who'd notice?

question: Here's your original scan... Here's it reverse-engineered... Fox hits a button and the unmarked bullet fragments are reassembled. Wayne spins the roughly-shaped bullet puzzle-
answer: And here's a thumb print. Fox looks at the screen, impressed. Thinks.

question: I'll make you a copy. Mr.Wayne, did you reassign R and D?
answer: Yes. Government telecommunications project.

question: I wasn't aware we had any new government contracts. Can you-
answer: Lucius. I'm playing this one pretty close to the chest.

question: Fair enough. Fox looks at Wayne as he leaves. Uneasy.
answer: I've run it through all the databases and came up with four possibles. Wayne gets up to let Alfred sit. Cross-reference the addresses. Look for Parkside and around. Wayne opens a HYDRAULIC DOOR, revealing a gleaming MV AUGUSTA BRUTALE. As he moves the bike onto the lift...

question: I'm sorry, Barbara. James Gordon pushes past his mother to look at Stephens. Barbara tries to push him back inside.
answer: Jimmy, go play with your sister... James stays just inside the door.

question: I'm sorry. Barbara stares at Stephens. Then looks past him.
answer: Are you out there?! Are you?! James spots something- Batman, perched in the shadows. You brought this on us! This craziness! You did! You brought this...! She collapses into Stephens's arms. Batman hangs his head.

question: Harvey, where are you?! INTERCUT with Dent in an INDISTINCT interior setting.
answer: Where are you?

question: Where you should be- at Major Crimes trying to sort through all the-
answer: Rachel, listen to me. You're not safe there.

question: This is Gordon's unit, Harvey-
answer: Gordon's gone, Rachel.

question: He vouched for these men-
answer: And he's gone. The Joker's named you next. Rachel looks around the bullpen. Eyeing the detectives. Rachel, I can't let anything happen to you. I love you too much.

question: Bruce. We can trust Bruce Wayne.
answer: Rachel, I know he's your friend but-

question: Trust me, Harvey, Bruce's penthouse is now the safest place in the city.
answer: Okay. Go straight there. Don't tell anyone where you're going. I'll find you there. Wider shows us we are- I love you. Dent hangs up the phone. TAPED to a chair in front of Dent- the Joker's Thug, blindfolded. Dent RIPS off the blindfold...

question: I want the Joker.
answer: From one professional to another-if you're trying to scare someone, pick a better spot. From this height the fall wouldn't kill me.

question: I'm counting on it. Batman lets go. Maroni FALLS. And SCREAMS. Where is he?
answer: I don't know, he found us-

question: He must have friends.
answer: Friends? You met this guy?

question: Someone knows where he is. Maroni looks up at Batman. Sneering.
answer: No one's gonna tell you anything- they're wise to your act- you got rules... the Joker, he's got no rules. No one's gonna cross him for you. You want this guy, you got one way. And you already know what that is. Just take off that mask and let him come find you. Batman DROPS Maroni. Or you want to let a couple more people get killed while you make up your mind?

question: You wanna play games? Dent PUSHES the gun against the thug's head with REAL MALICE. Pulls it away and FIRES. The Thug FLINCHES. Dent puts the gun barrel against the thug's temple- No. I wouldn't. That's why I'm not going to leave it up to me. Heads- you get to keep your head. Tails... not so lucky. So, you want to tell me about the Joker? The Thug, scared, says nothing. Dent FLICKS the coin into the air. SLAPS it onto the back of his gun hand . Dent shows him the coin. Heads. The Thug exhales, SHAKING. Go again? You're not playing the odds, friend. Dent tosses the coin again. This time IT DOESN'T LAND. Dent looks up. Batman is there.
answer: You'd leave a man's life to chance?

question: Not exactly.
answer: His name's Schiff, Thomas. He's a paranoid schizophrenic, a former patient at Arkham. The kind of mind the Joker attracts. Batman moves away from Schiff. What do expect to learn from him? Dent is shivering with frustration.

question: The Joker killed Gordon- and, and Loeb. He's going to kill Rachel...
answer: You're the symbol of hope that I could never be. Your stand against organized crime is the first legitimate ray of light in Gotham for decades. If anyone saw this, everything would be undone- all the criminals you got off the streets would be released. And Jim Gordon will have died for nothing. Batman hands Dent his lucky coin. You're going to call a press conference. Tomorrow morning.

question: Why?
answer: No one else will die because of me. Gotham is in your hands, now.

question: Harvey called. He says Batman is going to turn himself in.
answer: I have no choice.

question: You honestly think it's going to stop the Joker from killing?
answer: Perhaps not. But I've got enough blood on my hands. I've seen, now, what I would have to become to stop men like him. Rachel looks at Wayne. She cannot help him. You once told me that if the day came when I was finished... Wayne moves towards her. We'd be together.

question: Bruce, don't make me your one hope for a normal life- Wayne takes her in his arms.
answer: But did you mean it?

question: Even the logs?
answer: Anything that could lead back to Lucius or Rachel. Alfred tosses the book onto the fire. STARES at Wayne. People are dying, Alfred. What would you have me do? Alfred looks into Wayne's eyes with a fearsome gaze.

question: Endure, Master Wayne. Take it. They'll hate you for it, but that's the point of Batman... he can be the outcast. He can make the choice no one else can face. The right choice. Wayne shakes his head.
answer: Today I've found out what Batman can't do. He can't endure this. Today you get to say 'I told you so'.

question: Today, I don't want to. Although I did bloody tell you. Wayne sinks the Bat-suit, Alfred closes the incinerator. They head for the lift. I suppose they'll lock me up as well. Your accomplice.
answer: Accomplice? I'm going to tell them the whole thing was your idea. They power down, leaving the Bat-bunker in darkness.

question: Why is he letting Harvey do this, Alfred?
answer: I don't know. He went down to the press conference-

question: And just stood by?!
answer: Perhaps both Bruce and Mr.Dent believe that Batman stands for something more important than a terrorist's whims, Miss Dawes, even if everyone hates him for it.

question: Well, you're right about one thing- letting Harvey take the fall is not heroic. Rachel holds out an ENVELOPE. You know Bruce best, Alfred... give it to him when the time is right.
answer: How will I know?

question: It's not sealed. Alfred takes the envelope. Rachel gives him a kiss. Goodbye, Alfred.
answer: Goodbye, Rachel.

question: I'm sorry, I didn't have time to talk this through with you.
answer: Don't offer yourself as bait, Harvey.

question: They're transferring me to central holding. This is the Joker's chance, and when he attacks, Batman will take him down.
answer: No. This is too dangerous- The Detective knocks. Dent rises. He's using you as bait- but he doesn't know if he can get the Joker- he's failed so far.

question: How do you know what he's thinking?
answer: I just do, okay? Harvey, this isn't just about you, what about all the people counting on you to turn this city around? Tell everyone the truth- Dent kisses her. Pulls out his LUCKY COIN-

question: Heads I go through with it.
answer: This is your life... you don't leave something like this to chance... Dent tosses it at her- Rachel catches it. Looks. Heads.

question: I'm not. She turns it over
answer: You make your own luck. As SWATS file into the back of the support vehicles-

question: Stand away! All of you. I don't want anything for his mob lawyer to use, understand? Handle this guy like he's made of glass. The Mayor walks in. Shakes Gordon's hand.
answer: Back from the dead.

question: I couldn't chance my family's safety. The Mayor looks over at the Joker in his cage.
answer: What do we got?

question: Nothing. No matches on prints, DNA, dental. Clothing is custom, no labels. Nothing in his pockets but knives and lint. No name, no other alias... nothing.
answer: Go home, Gordon. The clown'll keep till morning. Get some rest- you're going to need it. Tomorrow, you take the big job. You don't have any say in the matter. Commissioner Gordon. The cops in M.C.U. start CHEERING.

question: Actually, this time I saved him. Gordon's phone rings- Has he said anything, yet? Ramirez shakes her head. Gordon PUSHES through a door...
answer: Evening, Commissioner.

question: Harvey Dent never made it home.
answer: Of course not.

question: What have you done with him?
answer: Me? I was right here. Who did you leave him with? Your people? Assuming, of course, that they are your people not Maroni's... Does it depress you, Lieutenant, to know how alone you are? Gordon can't help glancing at the mounted CAMERA. Does it make you feel responsible for Harvey Dent's current predicament?

question: Where is he?
answer: What time is it?

question: What difference does that make?
answer: Depending on the time, he might be in one spot. Or several. Gordon stands. Moves to the Joker. Undoes his handcuffs.

question: If we're going to play games, I'm going to need a cup of coffee.
answer: The good cop, bad cop routine? Gordon pauses, hand on the doorknob.

question: Not exactly. Gordon steps out. The overhead lights COME ON. BATMAN IS BEHIND HIM. The Joker BLINKS in the HARSH WHITE LIGHT. WHAM! The Joker's face HITS the table- comes up for air- CRACK! CRACK! To the head. Batman is in front of him. The Joker stares, fascinated. Bleeding.
answer: Never start with the head... victim gets fuzzy. Can't feel the next- CRACK! Batman's fist SMACKS down on the Joker's fingers. See?

question: Never start with the head... victim gets fuzzy. Can't feel the next- CRACK! Batman's fist SMACKS down on the Joker's fingers. See?
answer: You wanted me. Here I am.

question: I wanted to see what you'd do. And you didn't disappoint... You let five people die.
answer: Where's Dent?

question: Those mob fools want you gone so they can get back to the way things were. But I know the truth- there's no going back. You've changed things. Forever.
answer: Then why do you want to kill me? The Joker starts LAUGHING. After a moment he's laughing so hard it sounds like SOBBING.

question: Kill you? I don't want to kill you. What would I do without you? Go back to ripping off Mob dealers? No you... You. Complete. Me.
answer: You're garbage who kills for money.

question: Where's Dent?
answer: You have these rules. And you think they'll save you.

question: I have one rule.
answer: Then that's the one you'll have to break. To know the truth.

question: Which is?
answer: The only sensible way to live in this world is without rules. Tonight you're going to break your one rule... Batman leans in to the Joker.

question: I'm considering it.
answer: There are just minutes left- so, you'll have to play my little game if you want to save... ...one of them.

question: Them?
answer: For a while I thought you really were Dent, the way you threw yourself after her- Batman DROPS the Joker- RIPS up a bolted-down chair- Look at you go... does Harvey know about you and his-? The Joker SMASHES into the wall- SLIDES to the floor. Batman stands over him, a man possessed-

question: WHERE ARE THEY?! He GRABS the Joker, holding him close-
answer: Killing is making a choice... Batman PUNCHES the Joker across the face. HARD.

question: WHERE ARE THEY?! The Joker FEEDS off Batman's anger. Loving it.
answer: ...you choose one life over the other. Your friend, the district attorney. Or his blushing bride-to- be. Batman PUNCHES the Joker again. The Joker LAUGHS. You have nothing. Nothing to threaten me with. Nothing to do with all your strength... But don't worry, I'm going to tell you where they are. Both of them, and that's the point- you'll have to choose. The Batman stares at the Joker... He's at 250 52nd Boulevard. And she's on avenue X at Cicero.

question: I prepared a little breakfast. Nothing. Alfred sets down the tray. The envelope is propped against the silver teapot. Very well.
answer: Alfred?

question: Yes, Master Wayne? Wayne turns, a desperate look in his eye.
answer: Did I bring this on us? On her? I thought I would inspire good, not madness-

question: You have inspired good. But you spat in the face of Gotham's criminals- didn't you think there might be casualties? Things were always going to have to get worse before they got better.
answer: But Rachel, Alfred...

question: Rachel believed in what you stood for. What we stand for. Wayne looks up at Alfred. Alfred picks up the cowl. Gotham needs you.
answer: Gotham needs its hero. And I let the Joker blow him half to hell-

question: Which is why for now, they'll have to make do with you. Alfred hands him the cowl. Wayne looks at him.
answer: She was going to wait for me. Dent doesn't know. He can never know... Alfred glances at the envelope. Takes it off the tray. What's that?

question: It can wait. Alfred puts the envelope in his pocket.
answer: That bandit, in the forest in Burma... Did you catch him? How?

question: I'm sorry about Rachel. The Doctor says you're in agonizing pain but you won't accept medication. That you're refusing skin grafts-
answer: Remember the name you all had for me when I was at Internal Affairs? What was it, Gordon?

question: Harvey, I can't-
answer: SAY IT! Dent's anger makes Gordon flinch. He looks away. Ashamed.

question: Two-face. Harvey two-face. Dent turns to face Gordon- the left side of Dent's face is DESTROYED- skin blackened and shriveled. Molars visible. The eye a ball and socket. Dent manages a small smile with the good side of his face.
answer: Why should I hide who I am?

question: I... I know you tried to warn me. I'm sorry. Wuertz picked you up- was he working for them? Do you know who picked up Rachel? Harvey, I need to know which of my men I can trust. Dent looks at Gordon. Cold.
answer: Why would you listen to me now?

question: I'm sorry, Harvey.
answer: No. No you're not. Not yet. Gordon takes a last look at Dent. Then leaves.

question: Like I say- not so crazy as you look. The Joker jumps from the top, slides down the pile.
answer: I told you- I'm a man of my word. Where's the Italian? The Chechen shrugs. Pulls out a cigar. Lights it.

question: More for us. What you do with all your money, Mr.Joker? The Joker GRABS a can of GASOLINE from his thug.
answer: I'm a man of simple tastes. I like gunpowder. Dynamite... He is SPLASHING gasoline onto the money. ...gasoline... The Chechen, FURIOUS, steps forwards. The Joker turns. JABS his gun in the Chechen's face. The Chechen's bodyguards REACT. The Joker's men DRAW on them. And you know what they have in common? They're cheap.

question: You said you were a man of your word. The Joker PLUCKS the cigar from the Chechen's lips.
answer: I am. The Joker tosses the cigar at the pile. I'm only burning my half. All you care about is money. This city deserves a better class of criminal, and I'm going to give it to them. This is my town now. Tell your men they work for me. The Joker crouches down to the Chechen's dogs. They GROWL.

question: They won't work for a freak. The Joker takes out a knife. Tosses it to his man.
answer: Cut him up and offer him to his little Princes. Let's show him just how loyal a hungry dog is. The Joker's men GRAB the Chechen. It's not about money. It's about sending a message... The Joker watches the towering FLAMES. Lau screams. Everything. Burns. The Joker pulls out a phone...

question: That's simply not why I'm doing this.
answer: Caller, you're on the air. Guy's got a point- Dent didn't want Batman to give himself up, is this the right thing to do?

question: If we could talk to Dent now he might feel differently-
answer: And we wish him a speedy recovery. God knows we need him, now. Let's take another call-

question: I guess it would depend on the life. Of course not.
answer: Who is this?

question: I need you plugged in, checking Gordon's men and their families.
answer: Looking for?

question: Hospital admissions.
answer: Will you be taking the batpod, sir?

question: In the middle of the day? Not very subtle, Alfred.
answer: The Lamborghini then. Much more subtle.

question: You okay, Mr.Wayne? Wayne looks at him, woozy. Sits on the curb.
answer: Call me Bruce. I think so.

question: That was a brave thing, you did.
answer: Trying to catch the light?

question: You weren't protecting the van? Wayne turns- sees the police van as if for the first time. Reese steps down, dazed.
answer: Why? Who's in it? Reese locks eyes with Wayne. Nods. Gordon sizes up Bruce Wayne and his crushed sports car.

question: You don't watch a whole lot of news, do you, Mr.Wayne?
answer: It can get a little intense. Think I should go to hospital?

question: It's my day off. The Bartender shuts the register. What? You need me to shake it for- He TRAILS off as someone sticks a gun in his face
answer: Hello.

question: Dent, I thought you was...dead... Dent leans into the light. The left side of his face is HIDEOUSLY BURNED, cheek gone, blackened teeth and gums.
answer: Half. Dent picks up Wuertz's drink. Takes a SIP. Wuertz watches the bare muscles RETRACT as Dent SWALLOWS. Who picked up Rachel, Wuertz?

question: It must've been Maroni's men- Dent SLAMS the glass back on the table- Wuertz FLINCHES.
answer: You, of all people, are gonna protect the other traitor in Gordon's unit?

question: I don't know- he'd never tell me. I swear to God, I didn't know what they were gonna do to you-
answer: Funny, I don't know what's going to happen to you, either. Dent pulls his coin from his pocket. FLIPS it. Wuertz watches it SPIN. It lands on the table. Scarred side up. The drunk at the bar STIRS at the GUNSHOT.

question: Beautiful. Isn't it?
answer: Beautiful. Unethical. Dangerous. You've turned every phone in the city into a microphone... Lucius presses a key. The BABBLE of a MILLION CONVERSATIONS at once fills the room. Every cell phone in the city.

question: And high frequency generator/receiver.
answer: Like the phone I gave you in Hong Kong. You took my sonar concept and applied it to everybody's phone in the City. With half the city feeding you sonar you can image all of Gotham. This is wrong.

question: I've got to find this man, Lucius.
answer: But at what cost?

question: The database is null-key encrypted. It can only be accessed by one person.
answer: No one should have that kind of power.

question: My officers are going over every inch of the tunnels and bridges, but with the Joker's threat they're not and option.
answer: Land routes East?

question: Backed up for hours. Which leaves the ferries with thirty thousand waiting to board. Plus, corrections are at capacity, so I want to use a ferry to take some prisoners off the island.
answer: The men you and Dent put away? Those aren't people I'm worried about.

question: Don't stop for lights, cops, nothing.
answer: Going to join your wife? Maroni STARTS. Someone is in here with him. Harvey Dent- Two Face- leans forward, clutching a pistol. You love her?

question: Yes.
answer: Can you imagine what it would be like to listen to her die?

question: Take it up with the Joker. He killed your woman. Made you... like this...
answer: The Joker's just a mad dog. I want whoever let him off the leash. Maroni looks at Dent. Worried. I took care of Wuertz, but who was your other man inside Gordon's unit? Who picked up Rachel? It must've been someone she trusted.

question: If I tell you, will you let me go?
answer: It can't hurt your chances.

question: It was Ramirez. Pulls out his coin. Dent cocks the pistol... But you said-
answer: I said it couldn't hurt your chances. Dent FLIPS it. Looks Lucky guy. Maroni looks confused. Dent FLIPS the coin again. Looks down at the coin. Shakes his head. But he's not.

question: Who? Dent smiles. PUTS HIS SEAT BELT ON.
answer: Your driver. Dent presses the barrel of the revolver behind the shadow of the driver. Maroni LUNGES, SCREAMING. Dent FIRES.

question: Barbara, it's Anna Ramirez-
answer: Hi, Anna-

question: Listen carefully, there's no time. Jim needs you to pack up and get the kids in the car right away.
answer: But the units outside-

question: Barbara, those cops can't be trusted. Jim needs you away from them as soon as possible. I'll call them off for 10 minutes, you'll have to move fast-
answer: But where-

question: I'm going to give you an address- Jim will meet you there... 250, 52nd street. Leave as soon as the patrol car pulls out. Dent is holding a gun at Ramirez's head. She hangs up.
answer: She believe you? Ramirez nods. She trusts you. Just like Rachel did.

question: I didn't know-
answer: 'What they were gonna do'? You're the second cop to say that to me. What, exactly, did you think they were going to do?

question: I'm sorry- they got me early on. My mother's medical bills and my-
answer: Don't! Dent FLIPS his coin.

question: I took a little from them- once they've got you, they keep you. I'm sorry. Dent looks at his coin. Good side.
answer: Live to fight another day, officer. Dent CRACKS her on the head with his gun.

question: Then we have a hostage situation. They look across at the large windows of the Prewitt Building. The Joker's men, in crude, homemade CLOWN MASKS are clearly visible, automatic weapons in hand. It's a shooting gallery. Why'd he choose a spot with such big windows?
answer: He likes the view. Batman gestures towards the view of the ferries.

question: Let's do it.
answer: It's not that simple. With the Joker, it never is.

question: What's simple, is that every second we don't take him, those people on the ferries get closer to blowing each other up!
answer: That won't happen.

question: Then he'll blow them both up! There's no time- we have to go in now-
answer: There's always a catch with him-

question: That's why we can't wait- we can't play his games- Batman turns.
answer: I need five minutes. Alone-

question: No. There's no time. We have clear shots. Gordon pulls his gun. Batman turns back. The SWATS watch. Dent's in there with them. We have to save Dent! I have to save Dent! Get ready- Batman LEAPS from the building, OPENS his cape- SOARS across the gulf between the two buildings- Gordon puts his weapon away. Curses softly. Turns to the SWAT leader. Two minutes. Then you breach.
answer: Fox. I need picture.

question: Hello? Barbara, calm down-
answer: Hello, Jim.

question: Harvey? What the hell's going on?
answer: You're about to know what my suffering is really like... Gordon looks across at the Prewitt penthouse...

question: Where are you? Where's my family?!
answer: Where my family died. Click. Gordon looks at the SWAT leader. Pale.

question: You came. I'm touched.
answer: Where's the detonator? The Dogs LEAP at Batman- SMASH him to the ground...

question: All the old familiar places. Batman recoils in pain. The Joker BUTTS him- KNEES him- ENERGY explodes from his lean frame- he KICKS the injured Batman back towards the glass... If we don't stop fighting, we're going to miss the fireworks.
answer: There won't be any fireworks. Batman STRUGGLES to keep the beam from CRUSHING his neck... What were you hoping to prove? That deep down, we're all as ugly as you? The Joker looks at the clock... You're alone. The Joker CROUCHES down, hovering above Batman's face and arms. Shows him the remote.

question: Can't rely on anyone these days. The Joker ARMS the remote... Have to do everything yourself. I always have- and it's not always easy...
answer: No. But I know how you get these- Batman's SCALLOP BLADES FIRE OUT OF HIS GAUNTLET, nailing the Joker in the chest and arm- he STAGGERS back- Batman, freed, leaps forward- KICKS HIM OVER THE EDGE- GRABS the remote- The Joker GIGGLES as he FALLS, enjoying the ride. Something SLAMS into his leg, and he JERKS to a stop- BATMAN'S GRAPPLE. The Joker HOLLERS in pain as Batman HAULS him up.

question: Just couldn't let me go, could you? I guess this is what happens when an unstoppable force meets an immovable object. You truly are incorruptible, aren't you? Batman secures the Joker UPSIDE DOWN. The Joker is LAUGHING. You won't kill me out of some misplaced sense of self- righteousness... and I won't kill you because you're too much fun. We're going to do this forever.
answer: You'll be in a padded cell, forever.

question: Maybe we can share it. They'll need to double up, the rate this city's inhabitants are losing their minds...
answer: This city just showed you it's full of people ready to believe in good. The Joker looks up at him. A twinkle in his eye.

question: Till their spirit breaks completely. Until they find out what I did with the best of them. Until they get a good look at the real Harvey Dent, and all the heroic things he's done. Then those criminals will be straight back onto the streets and Gotham will understand the true nature of heroism.
answer: What did you do?

question: I took Gotham's white knight. And I brought him down to my level. It wasn't hard- madness is like gravity. All it takes is a little push. Joker laughs. Batman leaves him to the SWATS.
answer: Lucius. Find Harvey Dent.

question: Dent? No reply. Gordon makes his way deeper. Up the stairs.
answer: This is where they brought her, Gordon. After your people handed her over. This is where they bound her. This is where she suffered. This is where she died.

question: I know. I was here. Trying to save her. Dent TURNS, revealing his dark side.
answer: But you didn't, did you?

question: I couldn't.
answer: Yes, you could. If you'd listened to me- if you'd stood up against corruption instead of doing your deal with the devil.

question: I was trying to fight the mob- Dent MOVES towards Gordon.
answer: You wouldn't dare try to justify yourself if you knew what I'd lost. Have you ever had to talk to the person you love most, wondering if you're about to listen to them die? You ever had to lie to that person? Tell them it's going to be all right, when you know it's not? Well, you're about to find out what that feels like. Then you'll be able to look me in the eye and tell me you're sorry. Dent turns- steps over to Barbara- puts the gun to her temple-

question: Harvey. Put the gun down. You're not going to hurt my family.
answer: No, just the person you need most. So is it your wife?

question: Put the gun down. Dent moves the gun to point at Gordon's little girl. Please, Harvey... Dent moves to James Gordon. Brushes the hair out of the boy's eyes with the muzzle. Gordon SNAPS. Goddamit. Stop pointing that gun at my family, Dent.
answer: We have a winner. Dent pulls the boy away from his mother.

question: I'm sorry, Harvey. For everything. But, please. Please don't hurt him.
answer: You brought your cops?

question: All they know is there's a situation. They don't know who, or what. They're just creating a perimeter.
answer: You think I want to escape?! There's no escape from this- Dent indicates his face. His suffering.

question: No one needs to escape, because no one's done anything wrong. And nobody has to. Dent chuckles. A macabre sight.
answer: I've done plenty wrong, Gordon. Just not quite enough. Yet. Dent squeezes the gun a little tighter against the little boy's neck. The boy WHIMPERS.

question: I've done plenty wrong, Gordon. Just not quite enough. Yet. Dent squeezes the gun a little tighter against the little boy's neck. The boy WHIMPERS.
answer: You don't want to hurt the boy, Dent. Dent turns. Batman steps from the shadows.

question: It's not about what I want. It's about what's fair. You thought we could be decent men in an indecent world. You thought we could lead by example. You thought the rules could be bent but not break... you were wrong. The world is cruel. And the only morality in a cruel world is chance. Unbiased. Unprejudiced. Fair.
answer: Nothing fair ever came out of the barrel of a gun, Dent.

question: His boy's got the same chance she had. Fifty-fifty. Batman steps closer, desperate, trying to reach Dent.
answer: What happened to Rachel wasn't chance. We decided to act. We three. We knew the risks and we acted as one. We are all responsible for the consequences. Dent looks at Batman. Pleading.

question: Then why was it only me who lost everything? Batman looks into Dent's eyes. Emotional.
answer: It wasn't.

question: The Joker chose me!
answer: Because you were the best of us. He wanted to prove that even someone as good as you could fall.

question: And he was right.
answer: But your fooling yourself if you think you're letting chance decide. You're the one pointing the gun, Harvey. So point it at the people who were responsible. We all acted as one. Gordon. Me. And you. Dent is listening, the wheels in his deranged mind turning.

question: Thank-you.
answer: You don't have to-

question: Yes, I do. Gordon and Batman stare down at Dent's body. Grave. The Joker won. Gordon stares down at SCARRED SIDE of Harvey Dent. Harvey's prosecution, everything he fought for, everything Rachel died for. Undone. Whatever chance Gotham had of fixing itself... whatever chance you gave us of fixing our city... dies with Harvey's reputation. We bet it all on him. The Joker took the best of us and tore him down. People will lose all hope.
answer: No. They won't. They can never know what he did.

question: Five dead? Two of them cops? We can't sweep that under-
answer: No. But the Joker cannot win. Batman crouches to Dent's body. Gotham needs its true hero. Gently, he turns Dent's head so the good side of his face is up. Gordon looks from Dent's face to Batman. Understanding.

question: You? You can't-
answer: Yes, I can. Batman stands. Faces Gordon. You either die a hero or live long enough to see yourself become the villain. I can do those things because I'm not a hero, like Dent. I killed those people. That's what I can be.

question: No, you can't! You're not! Batman hands Gordon his police radio.
answer: I'm whatever Gotham needs me to be.

question: ...a hero. Not the hero we deserved- the hero we needed. Nothing less than a knight. Shining... They'll hunt you.
answer: You'll hunt me. You'll condemn me, set the dogs on me... ...because it's what needs to happen. Because sometimes the truth isn't good enough... ...sometimes, people deserve more.
